targets.query: SELECT last("PM2.5") FROM "DYNAMIC"."HALO3C" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "Location"

panels.description:
TVOC stands for Total Volatile Organic Compounds, and it's a measurement of the total concentration of VOCs in the air: 

Explanation
TVOC is a way to simplify reporting on the many organic chemical compounds that are present in the air. VOCs are a large group of chemicals that are found in many building materials and everyday products, and they release into the air through a process called off-gassing. 

Importance
TVOC is an important indicator of air quality in a building. Inhaling TVOCs can be harmful to your health, and the effects depend on the amount of exposure, the chemical makeup of the TVOCs, and the surrounding ventilation. 

Measurement
TVOC is usually expressed in micrograms per cubic meter (ug/m3), milligrams per cubic meter of air (mg/m3), parts per million (ppm), or parts per billion (ppb). 

Examples of VOCs
Some examples of VOCs include benzene, formaldehyde, ethylene glycol, methylene chloride, and toluene.

targets.query: SELECT last("PM2.5") FROM "DYNAMIC"."HALO3C" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "Location"

panels.title: TVOC

panels.description:
0-50: Good – Air quality is satisfactory, with little or no risk.

51-100: Moderate – Acceptable air quality, but sensitive groups may experience minor health effects.

101-150: Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups – People with respiratory conditions may experience health issues.

151-200: Unhealthy – Everyone may begin to experience health effects.

201-300: Very Unhealthy – Health alert; the entire population is likely to be affected.

301-500: Hazardous – Health warnings of emergency conditions; everyone is at risk.
